intro: Eatonia dudleyi, commonly known as the Dudley's eatonia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical or subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
